TopicTitle: Whack-a-Kerbal Propulsion: The Stupid Idea of the Future!

Articles.Content:
[sEPTEMBER 17, 2015: Wernher von Kerman explains his hair-brained scheme.]

"Ladies and gentlekerbs, may I haff your attention please? Thank you.

Recently, our lab team has discovered a new source of energy. Der energy comes from der strange round balls that we see flying around sometimes. We think that we can use der balls to propel und Racketen to space, with no cost and using only Newton Kerman's third law. It will be effective und very, very cheap! All we need is a few generous grants to get der project started.

Wait, where are you going? Don't leave! We are on the verge of und great scientific advancement! We're... oh, never mind."

~~~

Whack-a-Kerbal Propulsion: The Stupid Idea of the Future!

The basic premise of this challenge is simple: Build the best Whack-a-Kerbal-powered craft possible. Whether this means reaching an impressive altitude, creating a reliable craft, or even carrying the most payload... well, that's up to you! (Scoring will be detailed below.)

It shouldn't be a surprise that Whack-a-Kerbal can be used to push craft forward, but here's a proof-of-concept video (perhaps this will provide an idea of how to complete the challenge for those who can't visualize it). Note that the vehicle had its SAS off: in other trials where this absurd device had some help from reaction wheels, I've propelled it up to nearly three-quarters of a kilometer! I am sure, however, that there are some improvements to be made...

~~~

There are only a few rules, so read them carefully:

  • You may only use Whack-a-Kerbal balls to propel your craft. Nothing else should be used for thrust. You may put fuel on your craft as long as you don't use it. (I don't see why you would want to though.)
  • Please use only stock parts. Visual and information mods are allowed, but please don't use modded parts on your craft.
  • Don't use the debug menu except for Whack-a-Kerbal! You can also allow part clipping in editors, if you so choose, but please don't hack gravity, or allow infinite impact damage or anything like that.
  • Successful entries must have the following: A set of pictures containing at least one image in the VAB, one or more images of the craft in flight clearly showing the World Records you're breaking (see scoring for more on this), and one image of the F3 flight log after landing/crashing. More pictures and/or a video would also be nice. Successful entries must also contain in writing one or more World Records (however pedantic or silly) that their craft accomplished.

~~~

Okay, so what about scoring?

The scoring is largely up to you!

Because of the experimental nature of this design, there are many directions it can be taken. Thus, every design created will likely have its own strengths and weaknesses. Instead of having the challenge be simply "to fly the thing as high as possible" or "to carry the most mass," I'll ask people to come up with reasons their designs excel. These reasons can include legitimate, praise-worthy World Records ("Most Kerbals carried, highest flight with safe return"), pedantic World Records ("First craft to not use M-Beam 200 I-beams"), or downright silly World Records ("Most Kerbals killed in one launch, worst aesthetics"). You're allowed to give your craft as many World Records as you like (though adding more than two or three seems like it would be a little much.) Just be sure that whatever you want to feature on your craft exceeds the previous Record, if there is one.

Some World Records ("Highest flight, fastest speed, heaviest craft") are likely to be broken multiple times. Only the highest score is deserving of the Record, though I will make a note of former Records after they've been broken. It's entirely possible to change your entry after one or more of your Records have been broken, to accommodate for other Records you may not have mentioned before. Just please let me know of it, either via PM or by creating a new post on this thread.

This means that everyone is a winner, and everyone deserves a spot on the leaderboard! So, without further ado, I present the

Hall of Absurd World Records!

UpsilonAerospace: Former Highest Flight (204m), First Whack-a-Kerbal-powered vehicle!

SchweinAero: Current Highest Flight (1,098m), Most Kerbals Carried (1), Most KSC Buildings Demolished (1), First Craft Landed Intact!

[Your name here!]

~~~

...and I'll leave you with one final statement: If you couldn't already tell, this challenge isn't meant to be taken too seriously. Have some fun, blow stuff up, and enjoy yourself!

-Upsilon

One of the great things about this challenge is that, in theory, you could fly as high as you wanted with Whack-a-Kerbal propulsion. You could even create an aircraft, maybe! Even though the overall premise of this challenge is quite silly, there's a fair amount of potential here in my opinion...
